channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was loaded on its side in the delivery van. When driver noticed it was leaking, they fixed the orientation. DescribePack: Package was loaded on its side, causing liquid to leak out of one of the loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the driver realized the package was on its side they fixed the orientation.

item.title: Report E-2023110122
item.description:
Report E-2023110122

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal NKX experienced a UN2801 Keyazine Brown MO/LA Liquid release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3 ounces of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the tote body and trailer floor due to a loose cap. The cap was re-secured, and the impacted tote and trailer floor were wiped down and neutralized with a soda ash solution. A slosh test was conducted on the tote and verified the tote could be shipped on. The impacted rags were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110518
item.description:
Report X-2023110518

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The leaking pail was removed from sort, placed in a plastic-lined tote, and brought to the HWPA for processing. No other information is known. DescribePack: The pail leaked at the cap. It doesn't appear to be vented or loose, so possibly a seal failed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Since the cap is on the top of the pail, spillage was minor and mostly confined to the lid.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was removed from sort, placed in a lined tote, and brought to the QA area. No other information is known. DescribePack: The bottom corner of the plastic jug is dented and has a small puncture hole. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The leaking package was placed in a lined tote with an absorbent pad and brought to the QA area. Most spillage was contained in the carton and tote.

item.title: Report X-2023110492
item.description:
Report X-2023110492

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking, odorous fiberboard box found in tote on HMPA pallet. Prior events unknown but no load area scans present on ftrack. No prior images available on spidr (checking for any diamond labels). DescribePack: Two of eighteen (three 6pks) 16oz plastic bottles lost 4oz of fluid due to defective safety seals below the cap closure. One safety seal was found completely removed and stuck to underside of cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned; tote was lined with hazbag. Ventilation utilized.

item.title: Report X-2023111085
item.description:
Report X-2023111085

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG DROPPED DURING SORTATION. PKG WAS PLACED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE INSIDE THE HAZMAT CAGE FOR EVALUATION. DescribePack: CAN WAS CRACKED ON THE BOTTOM WHICH CAUSED INTERNAL LEAKAGE. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: PKG TURNED UPSIDE DOWN SO CONTENTS WOULDN'T LEAK. ALL REMAININ CONTENTS TURNED UPRIGHT AND CAPS TIGHTENED

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box found on HMPA staging pallet with no diamond labels. Label partially corroded. DescribePack: Three of three 121oz plastic bottles lost at least 0.1gal of fluid from loose cap closures with no safety seals under caps. No internal partitions between bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned. Spillage collected.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was loaded on its side in a delivery van. One of the bottles inside the package leaked onto shelf. Driver made sure no other packages were affected. DescribePack: Cap was loose after package was laid on its side DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: All other packages were moved away from the leak. Bottles were put upright when leak was found.

item.title: Report E-2023110025
item.description:
Report E-2023110025

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/31/2023, at 0959 hours, personnel in the CSXT Radnor Yard discovered GATX5945, a loaded tank car of Sulfuric Acid, leaking from top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Veolia, was notified directly. Marion Environmental Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a pressure relief vent with a blown rupture disc. After inspection it was found that the PRV did not have the required surge protection. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Jeff Humphries. Contractor personnel removed the blown rupture disk and installed anew 2” SS 165 psi rupture disk, decontaminated the car, and remediated the environmental impact. The car was held at Radnor Yard pending additional repairs by a certified Mobile Repair Unit.

item.title: Report E-2023110203
item.description:
Report E-2023110203

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to a forklift incident, approximately 1 gallon of Econet Backcoat (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The terminal stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor. The SDS was reviewed with terminal personnel and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per the SDS instructions. The released product, damaged pail, and oil-dri were placed into a 10 gallon metal drum and staged onsite for the Terminal to manage. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2023101440
item.description:
Report X-2023101440

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was found during sort operations at the Memphis hub. While investigating the package the spill agent observed the the metal can inside was dented causing the lid to open. The metal can was packaged with a positive closure ring. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023101229
item.description:
Report X-2023101229

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was found during sort operations at the Memphis hub. The fiberboard box contained a plastic jerrycan inside. While investigating the package the spill agent noticed that the cap was loose and the was the cause of the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023101228
item.description:
Report X-2023101228

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Oct 19th one piece of a twelve piece shipment was found to be leaking UN1263 Paint, 3, PGII during the PM sort. The package that leaked had a very badly dented 5 gallon drum inside that allowed the paint to escape. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and the shipper contacted to provide an amended shippers dec.
